This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=RESEARCH-DATAMAN.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-05T14:44:50Z Anna Clements 2015-03-05T14:44:24+00:00 2015-03-05T14:44:24+00:00 Research Data Manager Vacancy at St Andrews https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;427ec92c.1503 We are looking for an enthusiastic, experienced and highly motivated person to join our new Digital Research Division as Research Data Manager. This is an opportunity to help influence the development of services and systems within this brand new Division of the University Library, which includes support for Open Access, Digital Humanities and Research Data Management. [...] CODATA ED 2015-03-05T05:20:16-08:00 2015-03-05T05:20:16-08:00 Fwd: [rda-legalinterop-ig] Workshop on open licenses https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;322e8910.1503 The announcement below, original sent to the CODATA-RDA Group on Legal Interoperability may be of interest to the wider audience on this list.<br><br>With very best wishes,<br><br>Simon. CODATA ED 2015-03-05T05:13:57-08:00 2015-03-05T05:13:57-08:00 Fwd: Save the Date - Dryad Community Meeting, 27 May, American Geophysical Union, Washington DC https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;8f1ff631.1503 The Dryad Community Meeting is a valuable occasion to engage with an important an innovative initiative that is transforming research practice and providing a platform for publishing data underpinning research articles.<br><br>Save the date and come and find out more! Dryad Community Meeting, 27 May, American Geophysical Union, Washington DC.<br><br>With very best wishes, [...] Andy Turner 2015-03-05T12:34:43+00:00 2015-03-05T12:34:43+00:00 Re: Managing Sensitive Data https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;b46d1ec9.1503 Thanks Sarah,<br><br>Indeed yes. Leeds is establishing LIDA (http://www.lida.leeds.ac.uk/), an institute for data analytics that gets those working on CDRC and those working on the MRC Centre for Medical Bioinformatics projects (and others working on other things) in the same physical space. It should be a good place to have meetings and bring people and ideas together. [...] Khokhar, Masud 2015-03-05T12:31:49+00:00 2015-03-05T12:31:49+00:00 Re: EPSRC Expectations Awareness Survey https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;23ce8d30.1503 We would be interested as well Stuart, we are currently doing EPSRC focussed RDM workshops (with a very good response rate) but a survey (and its results) might also be very useful.<br><br>Best wishes,<br>Masud<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: Research Data Management discussion list [mailto:RESEARCH-DATAMAN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of stuart macdonald<br>Sent: 05 March 2015 11:35<br>To: RESEARCH-DATAMAN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: EPSRC Expectations Awareness Survey [...] stuart macdonald 2015-03-05T11:35:07+00:00 2015-03-05T11:35:07+00:00 Re: EPSRC Expectations Awareness Survey https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;e51cbd9c.1503 Thanks Valerie. Yes, it would be useful to share findings and chat<br>further next week.<br><br>All best,<br>Stuart<br><br>On 05/03/2015 11:09, Valerie McCutcheon wrote:<br>> Thanks Stuart,<br>><br>> We did a survey and interviews a while back which were very useful. We have been meeting with EPSRC award holders in particular more recently.<br>><br>> We are hoping to host some kind of get together/workshop soon on RDM so maybe sharing issues found might be a useful part of that.<br>><br>> Maybe catch a chat with you re this next week when we are over with you.<br>><br> [...] Valerie McCutcheon 2015-03-05T11:09:19+00:00 2015-03-05T11:09:19+00:00 Re: EPSRC Expectations Awareness Survey https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;ec8a5f33.1503 Thanks Stuart,<br><br>We did a survey and interviews a while back which were very useful. We have been meeting with EPSRC award holders in particular more recently.<br><br>We are hoping to host some kind of get together/workshop soon on RDM so maybe sharing issues found might be a useful part of that. [...] Sarah Currier 2015-03-05T10:49:06+00:00 2015-03-05T10:49:06+00:00 Re: Managing Sensitive Data https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;7793a97a.1503 Hi Andy et al,<br><br>Andy is no doubt aware of this given his connections at Leeds (see CDRC, part-located at Leeds Uni http://cdrc.ac.uk/) - but for everyone else's info, the ESRC's Big Data Network programme may be of interest, as the Phase 1 projects are looking specifically at sensitive and confidential data (ADRN http://adrn.ac.uk/) and the Phase 2 projects are working closely with them (we are one) where researchers using our services wish to use (and possibly create) confidential data (BDN2 http://www.esrc.ac.uk/research/major-investments/Big-Data/BDN-Phase2.aspx). [...] stuart macdonald 2015-03-05T10:20:16+00:00 2015-03-05T10:20:16+00:00 EPSRC Expectations Awareness Survey https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;3380432.1503 Dear All,<br><br>As many of you will already know EPSRC set out its research data<br>management (RDM) expectations for institutions in receipt of EPSRC grant<br>funding in April 2012, this included the development of an institutional<br>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdRoadmap\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. EPSRC assessment of compliance with these expectations will<br>begin on 1 May 2015 for research outputs published on or after that date. [...] Brian Westra 2015-03-04T13:31:30-08:00 2015-03-04T13:31:30-08:00 Re: Managing Sensitive Data https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;4026dc32.1503 Andy, I'm not in the UK but am interested in the outcomes of the project.<br>Based on web searches and policies shared by some of my colleagues, it<br>seems that most institutional data security policies utilize a 3- or<br>4-class categorization of institutional data, which might not be aligned<br>with research data or the processes and infrastructure associated with<br>research practices. [...] Inna Kouper 2015-03-04T12:44:18-05:00 2015-03-04T12:44:18-05:00 Re: Examples of good and bad RDM https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;b3356d3.1503 Hi,<br><br>we'll be further talking about how to collect data stories at the RDA<br>plenary and later at the IASSIST conference in June, so any feedback or<br>pointers would be very helpful. It's a time-consuming effort, but together<br>we can compile a great resource that is useful in outreach, teaching, and<br>research.<br><br>Any contribution, whether it's picking a story from Dorothea's list, making<br>suggestions on site and policies, or sending us news and photos will be<br>greatly appreciated! [...] Dorothea Salo 2015-03-04T10:36:45-06:00 2015-03-04T10:36:45-06:00 Re: Examples of good and bad RDM https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;c2905aa0.1503 Due to acute time poverty I can't possibly take this on solo, but I<br>would be most pleased to have the community plunder my linkspam lists<br>for stories for the blog:<br><br>https://pinboard.in/u:dsalo/t:horrorstories/<br>https://pinboard.in/u:dsalo/t:successstory/<br><br>Very glad to see this happening!<br><br>Dorothea<br><br>On 3/4/15 8:36 AM, Monica Duke wrote:<br>> Thanks to all those who have offered help and suggestions for the data stories site so far. data stories is a blog co-ordinated by the DCC and the RDA Engagement interest group to help collate and publish stories of RDM, as suggested in this thread over recent months.<br>><br>> We hope [...] Monica Duke 2015-03-04T14:36:09+00:00 2015-03-04T14:36:09+00:00 Re: Examples of good and bad RDM https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;2306c754.1503 Thanks to all those who have offered help and suggestions for the data stories site so far. data stories is a blog co-ordinated by the DCC and the RDA Engagement interest group to help collate and publish stories of RDM, as suggested in this thread over recent months.<br><br>We hope that the blog will truly be an international effort and we are trialling a form to collect stories, which can be accessed from the blog:<br>http://datastories.jiscinvolve.org/ [...] Aileen O'Carroll 2015-03-04T10:43:33+00:00 2015-03-04T10:43:33+00:00 Re: Managing Sensitive Data https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;7c8f2724.1503 Hi all<br><br>The Irish Qualitative Data Archive also contains some suggestions on how to manage social science which may be sensitive in our Best Practice Handbook,<br><br>http://www.iqda.ie/sites/default/files/IQDA_Best_Practice_Handbook.pdf<br><br>This sounds like a very useful project, I would be in following your work<br><br>all the best<br><br>Aileen<br><br>----- Original Message -----<br>From: Fred Clarke <fred.clarke@UCD.IE><br>Date: Wednesday, March 4, 2015 10:16 am<br>Subject: Re: Managing Sensitive Data<br>To: RESEARCH-DATAMAN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK [...] Sally Rumsey 2015-03-04T10:39:11+00:00 2015-03-04T10:39:11+00:00 ORA-Data vacancy. Digital Scholarship Support Officer (maternity cover) https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;413cc5eb.1503 Dear All,<br><br>The Bodleian Libraries are seeking to appoint a Digital Scholarship Support Office (maternity cover) to set up and run the ORA-Data service at a critical time for Research Data Management for the University. The ORA-Data service is currently in pilot mode and will be transitioning to production service over the coming year. [...] Matthew Dovey 2015-03-04T10:29:03+00:00 2015-03-04T10:29:03+00:00 FW: Announcement: Daffodil 1.0 Release https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;1c9d3d10.1503 Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;1c9d3d10.1503">FW: Announcement: Daffodil 1.0 Release </a> Fred Clarke 2015-03-04T10:05:21+00:00 2015-03-04T10:05:21+00:00 Re: Managing Sensitive Data https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;b61e644f.1503 Hi Andy<br>I am also interested in this topic, our first effort at data classification<br>and storage options for Researchers & Staff is here,<br>http://www.ucd.ie/itservices/userfileguide/<br><br>It gives customers a landing page and a contact point for further<br>discussions.<br>I will keep an eye on your project's progress.<br><br>Regards<br>Fred Clarke<br><br>Research IT<br>UCD IT Services<br>University College Dublin<br><br>http://www.ucd.ie/itservices/researchit/<br><br>On 3 March 2015 at 23:55, Andy Turner <A.G.D.Turner@leeds.ac.uk> wrote: [...] Robin Rice 2015-03-04T09:37:30-00:00 2015-03-04T09:37:30-00:00 Re: Managing Sensitive Data https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;42d56205.1503 Hi Andy,<br><br>I'm interested in that topic too. We're going to be delivering a 2 hour<br>training course on Working with Personal and Sensitive Data, with a view not<br>only on managing, but also sharing some anonymised form of the data. Cliff<br>Lynch in his talk at IDCC15 last month identified this as the most important<br>current barrier to resolve for data sharing. It certainly is an important<br>one at our institution. [...] John Milner 2015-03-04T07:18:13+01:00 2015-03-04T07:18:13+01:00 Re: Managing Sensitive Data https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;e41f369e.1503 Andy,<br><br>I think this is a very important piece of work and it may well be useful in Data Architecture development for business systems too.<br><br>John<br><br>Sent from my iPad<br><br>> On 4 Mar 2015, at 00:55, Andy Turner <A.G.D.Turner@LEEDS.AC.UK> wrote:<br>><br>> Hi,<br>><br>> (Apologies for cross posting and if the RDA posting is barking up the wrong tree (and if so please direct me).)<br>><br>> As part of the UK Jisc Research Data Spring (http://www.jisc.ac.uk/rd/projects/research-data-spring) I have got involved in planning a project that if funded will look at classifying sensitive research data and mapping this [...] agdturner 2015-03-04T00:57:28+01:00 2015-03-04T00:57:28+01:00 [rda-legalinterop-ig] Managing Sensitive Data https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;92577f1.1503 Hi,<br><br>(Apologies for cross posting and if the RDA posting is barking up the wrong tree (and if so please direct me).)<br><br>As part of the UK Jisc Research Data Spring (http://www.jisc.ac.uk/rd/projects/research-data-spring) I have got involved in planning a project that if funded will look at classifying sensitive research data and mapping this onto storage options for these data at different parts of the research data life-cycle. The main output from this work would be some guidance documentation aimed at UK institutions and researchers that are to be disseminated by the UK Digital Curation Centre. The early phases of the [...] Andy Turner 2015-03-03T23:55:52+00:00 2015-03-03T23:55:52+00:00 Managing Sensitive Data https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;92577f1.1503 Hi,<br><br>(Apologies for cross posting and if the RDA posting is barking up the wrong tree (and if so please direct me).)<br><br>As part of the UK Jisc Research Data Spring (http://www.jisc.ac.uk/rd/projects/research-data-spring) I have got involved in planning a project that if funded will look at classifying sensitive research data and mapping this onto storage options for these data at different parts of the research data life-cycle. The main output from this work would be some guidance documentation aimed at UK institutions and researchers that are to be disseminated by the UK Digital Curation Centre.
